detaileddescription.para: Tasks execute this type type of functions.

Create an "empty" task. It needs to initialzed with at least lv_task_set_cb and lv_task_set_period
pointer to the craeted task

memberdef.argsstring: (lv_task_cb_t task_xcb, uint32_t period, lv_task_prio_t prio, void *user_data)
memberdef.name: lv_task_create

detaileddescription.para:
Create a new lv_task
task_xcb
a callback which is the task itself. It will be called periodically. (the 'x' in the argument name indicates that its not a fully generic function because it not follows the func_name(object, callback, ...) convention)
period
call period in ms unit
prio
priority of the task (LV_TASK_PRIO_OFF means the task is stopped)
user_data
custom parameter
pointer to the new task

Delete a lv_task
task
pointer to task_cb created by task

Set the callback the task (the function to call periodically)
task
pointer to a task
task_cb
the function to call periodically

Set new priority for a lv_task
task
pointer to a lv_task
prio
the new priority

Set new period for a lv_task
task
pointer to a lv_task
period
the new period

Make a lv_task ready. It will not wait its period.
task
pointer to a lv_task.

Delete the lv_task after one call
task
pointer to a lv_task.

Reset a lv_task. It will be called the previously set period milliseconds later.
task
pointer to a lv_task.

Enable or disable the whole lv_task handling
en
true: lv_task handling is running, false: lv_task handling is suspended

Get idle percentage
the lv_task idle in percentage
